summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York inquiring whether Ghislaine Maxwell has received or been offered the COVID-19 vaccine. It appears to be official correspondence regarding Maxwell's detention or incarceration status.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the inquiry regarding COVID-19 vaccination status while presumably in custody.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, inquiring about Maxwell's vaccine status on behalf of the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York inquiring about the vaccination status of the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Vaccine Status Inquiry
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails to inquire whether Ghislaine Maxwell has received or been offered the COVID-19 vaccine.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The inquiry about Ghislaine Maxwell's COVID-19 vaccine status was made on March 6, 2021.
The inquiry originated from an Assistant United States Attorney at the Southern District of New York.
The document suggests Maxwell was in custody or under the supervision of authorities at that time.
The correspondence is official in nature, concerning the welfare/status of a federal defendant.
